history.text:
1A008 Charges, devices and “components,” as follows (see List of Items Controlled).
License Requirements
Reason for Control:
NS, AT, UN
Control(s) Country Chart (See Supp. No. 1 to part 738) NS applies to entire entryNS Column 2. AT applies to entire entryAT Column 1. UN applies to entire entrySee § 746.1(b) for UN controls.
Control(s)
Country Chart (See Supp. No. 1 to part 738)
NS applies to entire entry
NS Column 2.
AT applies to entire entry
AT Column 1.
UN applies to entire entry
See § 746.1(b) for UN controls.
List Based License Exceptions (See Part 740 for a description of all license exceptions)
LVS: $3000 for .a through .c; $6000 for .d.
GBS:
N/A
CIV:
N/A
List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Cutters, other than those specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, other than those specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: ‘Shaped charges’ are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
Related Definitions:
N/A
Items:
a. ‘Shaped charges’ having all of the following:

Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.

List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Cutters, other than those specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, other than those specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: ‘Shaped charges’ are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;

b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;

An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and

A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Cutters, other than those specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, other than those specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.

Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;

Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.

List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Cutters, other than those specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, other than those specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: ‘Shaped charges’ are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: 'Shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. LVS:
$3,000 for .a through .c; $6,000 for .d.
GBS:
N/A
List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: 'Shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

List Based License Exceptions (See Part 740 for a Description of All License Exceptions)
LVS:
$3,000 for .a through .c; $6,000 for .d.
GBS:
N/A
List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: 'Shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
Related Definitions:
N/A

LVS:
$3,000 for .a through .c; $6,000 for .d.
GBS:
N/A
List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: 'Shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

LVS:
$3,000 for .a through .c; $6,000 for .d.
GBS:
N/A
List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: 'Shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
Related Definitions:
N/A

(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: 'Shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: 'Shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239, and 1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN 1E001 for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: For the purposes of 1A008.a, 'shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.

Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.

for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: For the purposes of 1A008.a, 'shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239,
and

1E001

List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: For the purposes of 1A008.a, 'shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239,
and
1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN
1E001
for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: For the purposes of 1A008.a, 'shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.

for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

history.text:
1A008 Charges, devices and “components”, as follows (see List of Items Controlled).
License Requirements
Reason for Control:
NS, UN, AT
Control(s) Country chart (see supp. No. 1 to part 738) NS applies to entire entry (1A008) NS Column 2 AT applies to entire entry (1A008) AT Column 1 UN applies to entire entry (1A008) See § 746.1(b) for UN controls.
Control(s)
Country chart
(see supp. No. 1 to part 738)
NS applies to entire entry
NS Column 2
AT applies to entire entry
AT Column 1
UN applies to entire entry
See § 746.1(b) for UN controls.
List Based License Exceptions (See Part 740 for a Description of All License Exceptions)
LVS:
$3,000 for .a through .c; $6,000 for .d.
GBS:
N/A
List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: For the purposes of 1A008.a, 'shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239,
and
1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN
1E001
for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).
Related Definitions:
N/A

List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: For the purposes of 1A008.a, 'shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239,
and
1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN
1E001
for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

See § 746.1(b) for UN controls.

LVS:
$3,000 for .a through .c; $6,000 for .d.
GBS:
N/A
List of Items Controlled
Related Controls:
(1) All of the following are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130):
High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. High explosives and related equipment “specially designed” for military use;
a. 'Shaped charges' having all of the following:
Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
a.1. Net Explosive Quantity (NEQ) greater than 90 g; and
Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
a.2. Outer casing diameter equal to or greater than 75 mm;
Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Explosive devices or charges in this entry that utilize USML controlled energetic materials (See 22 CFR 121.1 Category V), if they have been specifically designed, developed, configured, adapted, or modified for a military application;
b. Linear shaped cutting charges having all of the following, and “specially designed” “components” therefor:
An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
b.1. An explosive load greater than 40 g/m; and
A width of 10 mm or more;
b.2. A width of 10 mm or more;
Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Shaped charges that have all of the following a uniform shaped conical liner with an included angle of 90 degrees or less, more than 2.0 kg of controlled materials, and a diameter exceeding 4.5 inches;
c. Detonating cord with explosive core load greater than 64 g/m;
Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Detonating cord containing greater than 0.1 kg per meter (470 grains per foot) of controlled materials;
d. Cutters, not specified by 1A008.b, and severing tools, having a NEQ greater than 3.5 kg.
Technical Note: For the purposes of 1A008.a, 'shaped charges' are explosive charges shaped to focus the effects of the explosive blast.
Note: The only charges and devices specified in 1A008 are those containing “explosives” (see list of explosives in the Annex at the end of Category 1) and mixtures thereof.
Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
e. Cutters and severing tools containing greater than 10 kg of controlled materials;
With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
f. With the exception of cutters and severing tools, devices or charges controlled by this entry where the USML controlled materials can be easily extracted without destroying the device or charge; and
Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
g. Individual USML controlled energetic materials in this entry, even when compounded with other materials, when not incorporated into explosive devices or charges controlled by this entry or 1C992.
(2) See also ECCNs 1C011, 1C018, 1C111, 1C239,
and
1C608 for additional controlled energetic materials. See ECCN
1E001
for the “development” or “production” “technology” for the commodities controlled by ECCN 1A008, but not for explosives or commodities that are “subject to the ITAR” (see 22 CFR parts 120 through 130).

N/A
